Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); GRAECO-ROMAN PERIOD (not after)
Name: Baboon presenting an udjat eye
Description: This figurine in faience represents a baboon seated on a rounded socle, presenting the udjat-eye. The animal symbolises the god Thoth, divinity of the intellect and more particularly of writing, who treated the eye of Horus injured in the mythical combat with Seth. The piece, which is equipped with an attachment, dates from the Late Period or from the Graeco-Roman Period.
